lines.content: // Detect OS and set the correct JavaFX classifier
* Exception thrown when a task description is missing.
* This exception is used to indicate that a required task description
* is missing when creating a new task.
* Constructs an {@code EmptyDescriptionException} with the specified error message.
* @param message The task type (e.g., "todo", "deadline", or "event") for which the description is missing.
super(String.format("OOPS!!! The description of a %s cannot be empty.",
* Exception thrown when a task index provided by the user is out of bounds.
* This exception is used to indicate that the specified task index
* does not exist in the current task list.
* Constructs an {@code IndexOutOfBoundException} with the specified invalid index.
* @param message The invalid index provided by the user.
super(message + " is not in your list.");
* Exception thrown when an invalid task type is encountered.
* This exception is used to indicate that the specified task type
* is not recognized or supported by the application.
* Constructs an {@code InvalidTaskTypeException} with the specified error message.
* @param message A descriptive error message indicating the invalid task type.
* Exception thrown when an unknown command is entered by the user.
* This exception is used to indicate that the user's input does not match any recognized command.
* It provides a default error message informing the user that the command is not understood.
* Constructs an {@code UnknownCommandException} with a default error message.
super("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* A command that clears the storage file while keeping the in-memory task list unchanged.
* This command deletes all tasks stored in the persistent storage file on the hard disk.
* However, it does not modify the current in-memory {@link Notebook} containing the list of tasks.
* If the storage is successfully cleared, a confirmation message is displayed to the user.
* If an error occurs during the clearing process, the appropriate error message is shown.
* Executes the command to clear the storage file while keeping the in-memory task list intact.
* This implementation removes all tasks stored in the hard disk storage file but does not affect
* the current in-memory {@link Notebook}. Upon successful clearing, a message is displayed to the user.
* If an error occurs while clearing the storage, an error message is shown instead.
* @param notebook The current in-memory {@link Notebook} containing the list of tasks (remains unchanged).
* @param ui       The {@link Ui} component used to display messages to the user.
* @param storage  The {@link Storage} system responsible for clearing the stored tasks.
public Notebook execute(Notebook notebook, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents an abstract command in the {@code Doopies} application.
* Each command defines an action that may:

*
  • Modify the in-memory {@link Notebook} (e.g., add, delete, mark tasks).

*
  • Interact with the {@link Ui} to display messages to the user.

*
  • Access the {@link Storage} system to save or retrieve tasks.
* Commands extending this class must implement the {@link #execute(Notebook, Ui, Storage)} method.
* Checks whether this command signals the application to terminate.
* @return {@code true} if the command signals the application to terminate; {@code false} otherwise.
* This method performs the action associated with the command, which may involve:

*
  • Updating the in-memory {@link Notebook} with new tasks or modifications.

*
  • Displaying messages to the user through the {@link Ui}.
* Each subclass must implement this method with its specific behavior.
* @param notebook The current in-memory {@link Notebook} containing the list of tasks.
* @param ui       The {@link Ui} used to interact with the user.
* @param storage  The {@link Storage} system responsible for saving or retrieving tasks.
* @return The updated {@link Notebook} after executing the command.
public abstract Notebook execute(Notebook notebook, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Represents a command to add a deadline task to the {@link Notebook}.

*
  • Extracts the task description and due date from user input.

*
  • Adds the deadline task to the {@link Notebook}.
* If the input format is incorrect or the description is empty, an error message is displayed.
* Constructs a {@code DeadlineCommand} with the specified parsed input.
* @param line The parsed input line containing the task description and due date.
* Executes the command to add a deadline task to the notebook.

*
  • Extracts the task description and due date from user input.

*
  • Checks if the description is empty and throws an exception if so.

*
  • Creates a new {@link Deadline} task and adds it to the notebook.

*
  • Saves the updated notebook to the {@link Storage} system.

*
  • Displays a confirmation message to the user.
* If the input is incorrect (e.g., missing a `/by` separator), an error message is displayed.
* @param notebook The current in-memory {@link Notebook} containing the list of tasks.
* @param ui       The {@link Ui} used to interact with the user.
* @param storage  The {@link Storage} system used to persist or retrieve tasks.
* @return The updated {@link Notebook} containing the new deadline task.
* @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException If the input format is incorrect (e.g., missing `/by`).
public Notebook execute(Notebook notebook, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* Represents a command to delete a task from the {@link Notebook}.

*
  • Retrieves the task index from the user input.

*
  • Removes the task at the specified index from the {@link Notebook}.

*
  • Updates the {@link Storage} system by saving the modified notebook.

*
  • Displays a confirmation message upon successful deletion.
* If the provided index is invalid (out of bounds or not a valid integer), an appropriate error message is displayed.
* Constructs a {@code DeleteCommand} with the specified parsed input.
* @param cmd The parsed input command containing the delete action and the task index.
* Executes the command to delete a task from the notebook.

*
  • Parses the task index from user input.

*
  • Checks if the index is within valid bounds.

*
  • Retrieves the task to be deleted for confirmation.

*
  • Persists the updated notebook to the {@link Storage} system.

*
  • Displays a confirmation message to the user.
* If the provided index is invalid or not an integer, an error message is displayed.
* @param notebook The current in-memory {@link Notebook} containing the list of tasks.
* @param ui       The {@link Ui} used to interact with the user.
* @param storage  The {@link Storage} system responsible for saving the updated notebook.
* @return The updated {@link Notebook} after removing the task.
public Notebook execute(Notebook notebook, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
Now you have %d tasks in the list.""",

* Represents a command to terminate the {@code Doopies} application.

*
  • Displays a farewell message to the user.
* Constructs an {@code EndCommand} that signals the application to terminate.
* Executes the command to terminate the application.

*
  • Displays a farewell message to the user via {@link Ui}.
* @param notebook The current in-memory {@link Notebook} containing the list of tasks (remains unchanged).
* @param ui       The {@link Ui} component used to display the farewell message and close resources.
* @param storage  The {@link Storage} system (not used in this command).
public Notebook execute(Notebook notebook, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to add an event task to the {@link Notebook}.

*
  • Extracts the task description, start time, and end time from user input.

*
  • Adds the event task to the {@link Notebook}.

*
  • Displays a confirmation message upon successful addition.
* If the input format is incorrect or the description is empty, an error message is displayed.
* Constructs an {@code EventCommand} with the specified parsed input.
* @param line The parsed input line containing the task description, start time, and end time.

*
  • Extracts the task description, start time, and end time from user input.

*
  • Validates that the description is not empty.

*
  • Creates a new {@link Event} task and adds it to the {@link Notebook}.

*
  • Saves the updated notebook to the {@link Storage} system.

*
  • Displays a confirmation message to the user.
* If the input format is incorrect (e.g., missing start or end time), an error message is displayed.
* @param notebook The current in-memory {@link Notebook} containing the list of tasks.
* @param ui       The {@link Ui} component used to interact with the user.
* @param storage  The {@link Storage} system responsible for saving the updated notebook.
* @return The updated {@link Notebook} containing the new event task.
public Notebook execute(Notebook notebook, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* Represents a command to find tasks in the {@link Notebook} that match a given keyword.

*
  • Extracts the search keyword from the user input.

*
  • Searches for tasks in the {@link Notebook} whose descriptions contain the keyword.

*
  • Displays the matching tasks to the user in a formatted list.

*
  • Leaves the {@link Notebook} and {@link Storage} system unchanged.
* Constructs a {@code FindCommand} with the specified parsed input.
* @param cmd The parsed input command containing the find action and the keyword to search for.
* Executes the command to search for tasks in the notebook that match the given keyword.

*
  • Retrieves a list of tasks from the {@link Notebook} that contain the specified keyword.

*
  • Formats and displays the matching tasks to the user.

*
  • Does not modify the {@link Notebook} or {@link Storage} system.
* If no matching tasks are found, an appropriate message is displayed.
* @param notebook The current in-memory {@link Notebook} containing the list of tasks.
* @param ui       The {@link Ui} component used to display the matching tasks to the user.
* @param storage  The {@link Storage} system (not used in this command).
public Notebook execute(Notebook notebook, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
String res = String.format("Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n%s",
* Represents a command to display all tasks currently in the {@link Notebook}.

*
  • Retrieves all tasks stored in the {@link Notebook}.

*
  • Displays the list of tasks to the user via the {@link Ui}.

*
  • Does not modify the {@link Notebook} or {@link Storage} system.
* If the notebook is empty, an appropriate message is displayed.
* Executes the command to display all tasks in the notebook.

*
  • Formats and displays them through the {@link Ui}.

*
  • If the notebook is empty, an appropriate message is shown.

*
  • Does not modify the {@link Notebook} or {@link Storage} system.
* @param notebook The current in-memory {@link Notebook} containing the list of tasks.
* @param ui       The {@link Ui} component used to display the list of tasks to the user.
* @param storage  The {@link Storage} system (not used in this command).
public Notebook execute(Notebook notebook, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to mark a task in the {@link Notebook} as completed.

*
  • Retrieves the task index from user input.

*
  • Updates the {@link Storage} system by saving the modified notebook.

*
  • Displays a confirmation message upon successful marking.
* If the provided index is invalid (out of bounds or not a valid integer), an appropriate error message is displayed.
* Constructs a {@code MarkCommand} with the specified parsed input.
* @param cmd The parsed input command containing the mark action and the task index.
* Executes the command to mark a task as completed in the notebook.

*
  • Parses the task index from user input.

*
  • Checks if the index is within valid bounds.

*
  • Persists the updated notebook to the {@link Storage} system.

*
  • Displays a confirmation message to the user.
* If the provided index is invalid or not an integer, an error message is displayed.
* @param notebook The current in-memory {@link Notebook} containing the list of tasks.
* @param ui       The {@link Ui} component used to interact with the user.
* @param storage  The {@link Storage} system responsible for saving the updated notebook.

* @throws IOException If an error occurs while saving the notebook to storage.
public Notebook execute(Notebook notebook, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* Represents a command to display the welcome message when the application starts.
* The {@code StartCommand} is executed at the beginning of the application lifecycle
* to greet the user with an introductory message. This command does not modify
* the notebook or interact with storage.
* This command does not require any parameters and serves only to display
* Executes the start command by displaying the welcome message.
* This implementation calls {@link Ui#showWelcome()} to display the introductory message.
* The notebook remains unchanged, and no modifications are made to storage.
* @param notebook The current in-memory {@link Notebook} (remains unchanged).
* @param ui       The {@link Ui} component used to display the welcome message.
* @param storage  The {@link Storage} system (not used in this command).
public Notebook execute(Notebook notebook, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

*
  • Extracts the task description from user input.

*

* If the description is missing or invalid, an error message is displayed.

* @param cmd The parsed input command containing the to-do action and task description.

*

public Notebook execute(Notebook notebook, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* Represents a command for handling unrecognized or invalid user input.

*
  • Detects and handles unknown commands entered by the user.

*
  • Displays an error message to inform the user that the input is unrecognized.

*
  • Leaves the {@link Notebook} and {@link Storage} system unchanged.
* Executes the command for handling unrecognized user input.

*
  • Displays an error message informing the user that the command is invalid.

*
  • Does not modify the {@link Notebook} or {@link Storage} system.
* @param notebook The current in-memory {@link Notebook} containing the list of tasks (remains unchanged).
* @param ui       The {@link Ui} component used to display the error message to the user.
* @param storage  The {@link Storage} system (not used in this command).
public Notebook execute(Notebook notebook, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to unmark a task as not done in the {@link Notebook}.

*
  • Retrieves the task index from user input.

*
  • Marks the specified task as not done.

*
  • Updates the {@link Storage} system by saving the modified notebook.

*
  • Displays a confirmation message upon successful unmarking.
* If the provided index is invalid (out of bounds or not a valid integer), an appropriate error message is displayed.
* Constructs an {@code UnmarkCommand} with the specified parsed input.
* @param cmd The parsed command arguments containing the unmark action and the task index.
* Executes the command to unmark a task as not done in the notebook.

*
  • Parses the task index from user input.

*
  • Checks if the index is within valid bounds.

*
  • Marks the specified task as not done.

*
  • Persists the updated notebook to the {@link Storage} system.

*
  • Displays a confirmation message to the user.
* If the provided index is invalid or not an integer, an error message is displayed.
* @param notebook The current in-memory {@link Notebook} containing the list of tasks.
* @param ui       The {@link Ui} component used to interact with the user.
* @param storage  The {@link Storage} system responsible for saving the updated notebook.
* @return The updated {@link Notebook} with the specified task unmarked.
public Notebook execute(Notebook notebook, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
String message = String.format("Alright! I've unmarked this task as done:\n\t%s",

* Represents a deadline task in the {@code Doopies} application.

*
  • A due date, stored as a {@code String} and optionally as a {@link LocalDateTime}.

*
  • A completion status (marked as done or not done).
* The due date can be formatted for display and parsed for date-based operations.
* Constructs a new {@code Deadline} task with the specified description and due date.
* @param task     The description of the deadline task.
* @param deadline The due date of the task in string format.
* Constructs a new {@code Deadline} task with the specified description, completion status, and due date.
* @param task     The description of the deadline task.
* @param done     The completion status of the task.
* @param deadline The due date of the task in string format.
public Deadline(String task, boolean done, String deadline) {
* Retrieves the formatted due date as a string.
* If the date is successfully parsed, it is returned in a formatted string.
* Otherwise, the original raw string provided by the user is returned.
* @return The formatted due date, or the raw string if parsing fails.
* Retrieves the due date of the task as a {@link LocalDateTime}.
* If the date cannot be parsed, this method returns {@link LocalDateTime#MAX}.
* @return The parsed due date as a {@link LocalDateTime}, or {@link LocalDateTime#MAX} if parsing fails.
* Marks this deadline task as completed.
* This method creates and returns a new instance of the deadline task with its completion status set to done.
* @return A new {@code Deadline} instance marked as done.
* Unmarks this deadline task (sets it as not done).
* This method creates and returns a new instance of the deadline task with its completion status set to not done.
* @return A new {@code Deadline} instance marked as not done.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task.

*
  • The prefix "[D]" to indicate a deadline task.
* @return A formatted string representing the deadline task.
* Represents an event task in the {@code Doopies} application.

*
  • A start time and an end time, stored as {@code String} values and optionally as {@link LocalDateTime}.

*
  • A completion status (marked as done or not done).
* The start and end times can be formatted for display and parsed for date-based operations.
* Constructs a new {@code Event} task with the specified description, start time, and end time.
* @param task  The description of the event task.
* @param start The start time of the event in string format.
* @param end   The end time of the event in string format.
public Event(String task, String start, String end) {
* Constructs a new {@code Event} task with the specified description, completion status, start time, and end time.
* @param task  The description of the event task.
* @param done  The completion status of the event task.
* @param start The start time of the event in string format.
* @param end   The end time of the event in string format.
public Event(String task, boolean done, String start, String end) {
* Retrieves the formatted start time of the event.
* If the start time is successfully parsed, it is returned in a formatted string.
* Otherwise, the original raw string provided by the user is returned.
* @return The formatted start time, or the raw string if parsing fails.
* Retrieves the formatted end time of the event.
* If the end time is successfully parsed, it is returned in a formatted string.
* Otherwise, the original raw string provided by the user is returned.
* @return The formatted end time, or the raw string if parsing fails.
* Retrieves the start time of the event as a {@link LocalDateTime}.
* If the start time cannot be parsed, this method returns {@link LocalDateTime#MAX}.
* @return The parsed start time as a {@link LocalDateTime}, or {@link LocalDateTime#MAX} if parsing fails.
* Marks this event task as completed.
* This method creates and returns a new instance of the event task with its completion status set to done.
* @return A new {@code Event} instance marked as done.
return new Event(this.getTask(), true, this.start, this.end);
* Unmarks this event task (sets it as not done).
* This method creates and returns a new instance of the event task with its completion status set to not done.
* @return A new {@code Event} instance marked as not done.
return new Event(this.getTask(), false, this.start, this.end);
* Returns a string representation of the event task.

*
  • The prefix "[E]" to indicate an event task.

*
  • The formatted start time and end time.
* @return A formatted string representing the event task.
return String.format("[E]%s (from: %s to: %s)", super.toString(), this.getStart(), this.getEnd());
* Represents a notebook that stores a list of tasks.
* This class provides immutable operations to:

*
  • Search for tasks containing a specific keyword.
* Each operation creates a new {@code Notebook} instance to ensure immutability.
* Constructs a {@code Notebook} with the specified list of tasks.
* @param list The list of tasks to initialize the notebook with.
* Adds one or more tasks to the notebook.
* @param task The tasks to be added to the notebook.
* @return A new {@code Notebook} instance containing the added tasks.
* Marks a task at the specified index as completed.
* @param idx The index of the task to mark as done (1-based index).
* @return A new {@code Notebook} instance with the specified task marked as done.
* Unmarks a task at the specified index as not done.
* @param idx The index of the task to unmark (1-based index).
* @return A new {@code Notebook} instance with the specified task unmarked.
* Deletes a task at the specified index.
* @param idx The index of the task to delete (1-based index).
* @return A new {@code Notebook} instance with the specified task removed.
* Returns the total number of tasks in the notebook.
* @return The number of tasks in the notebook.
* Retrieves a task at the specified index.
* @param idx The index of the task to retrieve (1-based index).
* @return The {@code Task} at the specified index.
* Retrieves all tasks in the notebook as an immutable list.
* @return A list of all tasks in the notebook.
* Finds all tasks in the notebook that contain the specified keyword in their description.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in the task descriptions.
* @return A list of {@code Task} objects that contain the specified keyword in their description.
* Returns a string representation of the notebook.

*
  • A sequentially numbered list of all tasks in the notebook.
* @return A formatted string representing the notebook.
return String.format("Here are the tasks in your list:\n%s",
* Represents an abstract task in the {@code Doopies} application.
* Subclasses of {@code Task} must implement methods for marking and unmarking tasks.
* Constructs a new {@code Task} with the specified description and an initial status of not done.
* @param task The description of the task.
* Constructs a new {@code Task} with the specified description and completion status.
* @param task The description of the task.
* @param done The completion status of the task.
* Checks whether the task is marked as done.
* @return {@code true} if the task is marked as done, otherwise {@code false}.
* Retrieves the description of the task.
* Subclasses must provide an implementation that creates and returns a new instance
* of the task with its completion status set to done.
* @return A new {@code Task} instance marked as done.
* Unmarks the task, setting its status to not done.
* Subclasses must provide an implementation that creates and returns a new instance
* of the task with its completion status set to not done.
* @return A new {@code Task} instance marked as not done.
* Returns a string representation of the task.

*
  • The completion status, represented as "[X]" if done, or "[ ]" if not done.
* @return A formatted string representing the task.
* Represents a to-do task in the {@code Doopies} application.
* A to-do task is a simple task with:
* The task supports marking, unmarking, and a formatted string representation.
* Constructs a new {@code ToDo} task with the specified description.
* @param task The description of the to-do task.
* Constructs a new {@code ToDo} task with the specified description and completion status.
* @param task The description of the to-do task.
* @param done The completion status of the to-do task.
* Marks this to-do task as completed.
* This method creates and returns a new instance of the to-do task with its completion status set to done.
* @return A new {@code ToDo} instance marked as done.
* Unmarks this to-do task (sets it as not done).
* This method creates and returns a new instance of the to-do task with its completion status set to not done.
* @return A new {@code ToDo} instance marked as not done.
* Returns a string representation of the to-do task.

*
  • The prefix "[T]" to indicate a to-do task.

*
  • The task's completion status (marked as "X" if done, or " " if not done).
* @return A formatted string representing the to-do task.
* Handles storage operations for saving and loading tasks to and from a file.
* The {@code Storage} class provides methods to:

*
  • Save tasks from a {@link Notebook} to disk.

*
  • Load tasks from disk into a {@link Notebook}.
* The tasks are stored in a structured format to facilitate reading and writing operations.
* Constructs a new {@code Storage} instance with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The path to the file used for storing tasks.
* Loads tasks from the storage file into a {@link Notebook}.
* If the file does not exist, it is created along with any necessary directories.
* Invalid task lines in the file are skipped, and a warning is logged to the console.
* @return A {@link Notebook} containing the tasks loaded from the file.
* @throws IOException If an error occurs while reading from or creating the file.
private Task parseTask(String line) throws InvalidTaskTypeException {
case "E" -> new Event(description, isDone, parts[3], parts[4]);
default -> throw new InvalidTaskTypeException("Invalid task type");
* Saves tasks from a {@link Notebook} to the storage file.
* The tasks are saved in a structured format and sorted based on the {@link TaskComparator}.
* @param notebook The {@link Notebook} containing the tasks to save.
* @throws IOException If an error occurs while writing to the file.
public void save(Notebook notebook) throws IOException {
* Clears all tasks from the storage file.
* @throws IOException If an error occurs while writing to the file.
* Represents a dialog box used in the {@code Doopies} application's user interface.

*
  • A text label displaying the dialog message.

*
  • An {@link ImageView} showing the speaker's profile picture.
* It supports user and application responses, with application messages being flipped for differentiation.
* Creates a dialog box representing the user's message.
* @param text The text message from the user.
* @return A {@code DialogBox} containing the user's message.
public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String text, Image img) {
* Creates a dialog box representing the application's response.
* The returned dialog box is flipped to visually differentiate system responses.
* @param text The response text from the application.
* @return A flipped {@code DialogBox} containing the application's response.
public static DialogBox getDoopiesDialog(String text, Image img) {
* Represents the core logic of the {@code Doopies} application.
* This class is no longer the main entry point; instead, {@link Main} serves as the application's main launcher.
* Constructs a new {@code Doopies} instance with a specific file path for task storage.
* Initializes the {@link Storage}, {@link Ui}, and attempts to load existing tasks from the file.
* If loading fails, a new empty {@link Notebook} is created.
* Processes the user's input and returns the corresponding response.

*
  • Parses the user input to determine the appropriate {@link Command}.

*
  • Executes the command, modifying the {@link Notebook} and interacting with storage as needed.

*
  • Retrieves the latest response message from the {@link Ui}.
* @return The system's response message based on the executed command.
* The main entry point for the {@code Doopies} application.
* This class initializes the graphical user interface (GUI) using JavaFX and
* loads the {@code MainWindow} layout. It also creates an instance of {@link Doopies}
private final Doopies doopies = new Doopies();

*
  • Initializes the scene and sets it on the primary stage.

*
  • Links the {@code Doopies} instance to the {@code MainWindow} controller.
* @param stage The primary JavaFX stage for the application.
* This method is automatically called when the program starts, and it invokes
* {@code Application.launch()} to initialize the JavaFX runtime.
* @param args Command-line arguments passed to the application.
* Represents the main user interface window for the {@code Doopies} application.
* This class manages user interactions, including:
* Binds the scroll pane's vertical property to the height of the dialog container,
* ensuring that new messages are always visible.
double deltaY = event.getDeltaY() * -1; // Reverse direction if needed

* A comparator for sorting tasks in the doopies.userinterface.Doopies application.
* The {@code TaskComparator} sorts tasks based on their type and specific criteria:

*
  • {@link ToDo} tasks are sorted alphabetically by their description.

*
  • {@link Deadline} tasks are sorted by their due date.

*
  • {@link Event} tasks are sorted by their start date.
*     <li>Tasks of different types are sorted in the following order:
* Compares two {@link Task} objects for order.

*
  • If both tasks are {@link ToDo}, they are compared alphabetically by description.

*
  • If one task is a {@link ToDo}, it is considered smaller than a {@link Deadline} or {@link Event}.

*
  • If both tasks are {@link Deadline}, they are compared by their due dates.

*
  • If both tasks are {@link Event}, they are compared by their start dates.
*     <li>If one task is a {@link Deadline} and the other is an {@link Event}, they are compared
* by the deadline's due date and the event's start date.
* If none of the above rules apply, tasks are compared alphabetically by description as a fallback.
* @param t1 The first task to compare.
* @param t2 The second task to compare.
* @return A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as {@code t1} is less than, equal to,

REM Run the program, feed commands from input.txt file, and redirect the output to ACTUAL.TXT
REM Normalize files by trimming whitespace and converting to consistent line endings
for /f "tokens=* delims=" %%a in (ACTUAL.TXT) do echo %%a >> ACTUAL_NORMALIZED.TXT
for /f "tokens=* delims=" %%a in (EXPECTED.TXT) do echo %%a >> EXPECTED_NORMALIZED.TXT
echo Differences found between ACTUAL.TXT and EXPECTED.TXT:
